title: Director, Enterprise Architecture
content:
We are seeking a Director of Enterprise Architecture to lead Airtable’s enterprise architecture strategy. As the first Enterprise Architecture hire at the company, you’ll be tasked with building the function from the ground up. You’ll be responsible for aligning our technology systems, infrastructure, and applications with our business goals and objectives. You’ll collaborate closely with key stakeholders to analyze our current IT landscape, identify opportunities for improvement, and establish a future-proof enterprise architecture framework. This is a highly strategic role, reporting directly to our CIO, and owning company-wide initiatives.
What you'll do

Lead the company’s Architecture Review Board
Lead the company’s Integrations Center of Excellence (CoE)
Lead the company’s Automations & AI CoE, including establishing automation goals (i.e., hours saved)
Implement Systems Governance program company-wide
Establish enterprise-wide architecture principles, standards, and policies, outlining guidelines for the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of systems and artifacts, like the company’s reference architecture, key templates, and roadmaps
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to identify key systems challenges opportunities for automation and ways to support enterprise architecture elements, like technical evaluation of vendors, reference architectures, and future state systems strategies

Who you are

Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience (10+ years) in enterprise architecture, with a focus on software solutions and systems integration
Strong knowledge of architectural frameworks, methodologies, and best practices
Strong knowledge of 1-2 key platform systems: Salesforce, NetSuite, Workday, or competitors
Experience in leading and managing a team of architects
In-depth understanding of software development lifecycle, cloud technologies, and modern software architectures
Proficiency in evaluating and selecting technology solutions, assessing risks, and making strategic recommendations
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a strategic mindset and the ability to think holistically

Compensation awarded to successful candidates will vary based on their work location, relevant skills and experience. The base salary range for this role is $266,800 - $377,900 for work locations in San Francisco, Mountain View, Seattle, NYC and LA. The base salary range for this role is $240,200 - $340,100 for all other work locations including remote. Our total compensation package also includes the opportunity to receive benefits, restricted stock units, and may include incentive compensation.To learn more about our comprehensive benefit offerings, please check out Life at Airtable.
Airtable is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and strive to create a workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any characteristic protected by applicable federal and state laws, regulations and ordinances. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
